title: After Another Mass Shooting, Questions Loom About the Role of Parents
abstract: Mothers and fathers of young men accused in shootings, including the 21-year-old charged in the massacre in Highland Park, Ill., have faced scrutiny.

title: Inside a Uvalde Classroom: A Taunting Gunman and 78 Minutes of Terror
abstract: A teacher who survived the mass shooting recounts the harrowing attack and desperate wait for a rescue.

multimedia.caption: “I kept waiting for someone to come,” Arnulfo Reyes, a teacher who was wounded in the shooting at Robb Elementary School, said about the delayed police response.

title: ‘I Felt Trapped’: Sexual Abuse of Teens in the Military’s J.R.O.T.C. Program
abstract: Former students say military veterans who led J.R.O.T.C. classes in U.S. high schools fashioned themselves as mentors, then used their power to manipulate and abuse.
byline: By Mike Baker, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Ilana Marcus and Mary F. Calvert
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: Some Students Want Colleges to Provide the Abortion Pill. Schools Are Resisting.
abstract: Even in states that protect abortion rights, colleges are proceeding with caution.

title: Students Are Learning Well Again. But Full Recovery? That’s a Long Way Off.
abstract: A new report estimates that it may take students at least three to five years to recover from the pandemic. Federal relief money will most likely have run out by then.

title: What to Watch For in Tuesday’s Primary Elections in Maryland
abstract: There are close contests in the Democratic and Republican primaries for governor, and in a few House races as the dust settles from redistricting. But the winners could take days to be called.

title: Trump National Security Aide Expected to Testify at Jan. 6 Hearing

title: Bystander Killed Gunman 2 Minutes Into Indiana Mall Shooting
abstract: The gunman used a rifle to kill three people and injure two others before he was shot dead. He had spent an hour inside a mall bathroom apparently preparing for the attack.

title: Five takeaways from the first day of the Parkland school shooting trial.
abstract: Jurors are hearing evidence about aggravating factors that might warrant recommending the death penalty for the gunman, who has pleaded guilty to 17 counts of murder.

title: Democrats Navigate Nuanced Views on Abortion Among Black Voters
abstract: Faced with a streak of conservatism about abortion among some Black Americans, a vital constituency for President Biden, Democrats are framing the issue as part of a broader civil rights struggle.

title: How Joe Manchin Left a Global Tax Deal in Limbo
abstract: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen’s signature achievement is in jeopardy if the United States cannot ratify the tax agreement that she brokered.

title: U.S. aid chief criticizes China’s ‘absence’ in a food crisis stoked by Russia’s invasion.
abstract: Samantha Power, the administrator of the U.S. Agency for International Development, criticized China for hoarding fertilizer and grain while millions of people in East Africa face starvation.
